chapter.title: Updating &rook;
chapter.para: This chapter describes how to update containerized &productname; &prevproductnumber; on top of a &caasp; 4.5 &kube; cluster.

This chapter takes you through the steps to update the software in a &rookceph; cluster from one version to the next. This includes both the &rookceph; operator software itself as well as the &ceph; cluster software.

sect1.title: Recommended hardware specifications
sect1.para: For &productname; deployed with &rook;, the minimal configuration is preliminary, we will update it based on real customer needs.
For the purpose of this document, consider the following minimum configuration:

listitem.para: A highly available &kube; cluster with 3 master nodes
Four physical &kube; worker nodes, each with two OSD disks and 5 GB of RAM per OSD disk
Allow additional 4 GB of RAM per additional daemon deployed on a node
Dual-10 Gb ethernet as bonded network
If you are running a hyper-converged infrastructure (HCI), ensure you add any additional requirements for your workloads.

sect1.title: Patch release upgrades
sect1.para: To update a patch release of &rook; to another, you need to update the common resources and the image of the &rook; operator.

step.para: Get the latest common resource manifests that contain the relevant changes to the latest version:
Apply the latest changes from the next version and update the &rook; Operator image:
step.screen: &prompt.kubeuser;kubectl apply -f common.yaml -f crds.yaml &prompt.kubeuser;kubectl -n rook-ceph set image deploy/rook-ceph-operator rook-ceph-operator=rook/ceph:version-number

note.para: We recommend updating the &rookceph; common resources from the example manifests before any update. The common resources and CRDs might not be updated with every release, but K8s will only apply updates to the ones that changed.

sect1.title: Rook-Ceph Updates
sect1.para: This is a general guide for updating your &rook; cluster. For detailed instructions on updating to each supported version, refer to the upstream &rook; upgrade documentation: .

important.para: &rook; releases from master are expressly unsupported. It is strongly recommended that you use official releases of &rook;.

sect1.para: In order to successfully upgrade a &rook; cluster, the following prerequisites must be met:

listitem.para: Cluster health status is healthy with full functionality.
All pods consuming &rook; storage should be created, running, and in a steady state.

sect1.para: Each version upgrade has specific details outlined in the &rook; documentation. Use the following steps as a base guideline.

note.para: These methods should work for any number of &rookceph; clusters and &rook; operators as long as you parameterize the environment correctly. Merely repeat these steps for each &rookceph; cluster (ROOK_CLUSTER_NAMESPACE), and be sure to update the ROOK_OPERATOR_NAMESPACE parameter each time if applicable.

step.para: Wait for the upgrade to complete and verify the updated cluster.
Update CephRBDMirror and CephBlockPool configuration options.
